Awesome game, well worth the money. 20/10

I played this game a LOT with my friends (Its way better if you play it with friends).
The perks are awesome, they all add something to the table, makes you feel like you are making progress when you level them and get additional %damage %accuracy %RealodSpd etc. 
The specimens are nice, they actually are kinda creepy so it adds a nice touch, the Scrake (the guy with the chainsaw) is awesome... When you see a FleshPound all you do is run backwards while typing for help.

Its an awesome game overall, really fun, really easy to get into it.
un exelente juego :3

I program computer games at university and as a result a lot of people upon hearing this ask "What's your favourite game then?!". I answer quite assertively "Killing Floor". It's defines co-op survival for me and most importantly it's timeless! I've had it for years and the reason it's my favourite game isn't because I play it every day religiously but because every four, six or 12 months I can say to a few mates "Wanna go on KF?!" and we can always have a few weeks on it.

The progression system is long yes and it takes a lot of time to upgrade your perks but that's what makes it a lasting game. I have <see above> hours on record and only have one perk maxed. This being the case I still can't consistantly beat the hardest difficulty! The perks match the difficulty of servers well and you may be on the medium difficulty for months, some times winning and sometimes losing. This will definitely keep you interested though! No one wants a survival game that they win every time... 

Tl;DR - Sick game, hours of content, a long (rewarding) grind for perks and intense difficulty scaling that will keep you playing on and off for years (or until KF2 comes out!).
Отличный симулятор скачивания различных паков, саундтреков и прочей фигни

One thing I really enjoy about this game is how easy it is to setup and launch a server. Due to the fact i am a huge fan of hosting my own servers for personal and/or friend/community usage this is a highlight for me. The gameplay is entertaining and I love how flexible the graphics settings are, me being on a laptop for my main gaming rig kind of limits what i can and cannot play due to a serious lack of fps however with killing floor it is a different story due to the fact you can change the graphics settings to where this is not as much of an issue.

Killing Floor is the awesome, goriest, and the best co-op survival horror. You can kill ZEDs to thousands of ways, and if you are bored being a Commando or Sharpshooter you can test your experience being Firebug or my favourite Berserker perk. You have seven perks which you can level-up to gold rank. Tripwire Interactive is creating cool maps, and really good events where you can win DLC and have a lot of fun like a Twisted Christmas, Halloween Events or Summer Events. Our buddy zYnthetic created atmospheric rock, and electro music soundtrack. In the workshop you can subscribe and download hundreds of epic maps, and weapon skins. When i play this game i feel relaxed as both full of adrenaline to cause havoc on fleshpounds and spend a lot of DOSH! at the shop. Funny character's comments make this game more funny. I really recommend this game for everyone.

What's not to love about this game? Killing floor is an awesome (zombie?) themed survival game. Its definately a good time killer if your playing solo but truely a masterpiece with a few friends. Killing Floor has a mysterious semi-hidden storyline that reveals itself through hints found in maps and the objective modes. With such a strong mdding community on the Steam Workshop its hard to get bored of Killing Floor! Gor those of you that want your own content, Killing floor uses Unreal 2004 engine which is very easy to learn if you want to make your own maps! I would deffinately recomend Killing Floor to anyone who was curious. One of my favorites!

Отличная игра, одна из лучших в своем классе. Игра в которой действительно важны тактика, команда и правильный подбор  перков. Графика конечно старовата, но смысл здесь совсем не в ней, для погружения ее вполне хватает, а ещё \тому способствует прекрасное звуковое сопровождение!
love it!!!!

killing floor is a pve-based fps-horror-survival shooter. you and up to three other ppl are fighting waves of creatures with a large viariety of weapons. you can choose between 6 or 7 perks, each one has its own pros, like faster reloading-times for some specific weapons, more damage etc. you get money for killing monsters and healing other ppl, and at the end of every round you have to hurry to get to the trader, which is located in a random spot on the map, to buy weapons, refill ammo, change your class or trade money and weapons with your teammates (yes thats possible, even though you can only drop stuff).

killing floor is a solid game, and even though tripwire is an indie-developer-team, the game ran smoth from day one, since than it recieved weekly or monthly updates, free weapons and skin-patches, theme-changes and tons of other stuff to make kf more likeable than it was already in the first place. 

my alltime favorite game, and that for just 15 bucks in the preorder-section. thats how you win customers and bind them. ill preorder kf-2 as soon as its ready, because tripwire deserves my money (unlike publishers like EA, tripwire takes its time and releases its products when they are finished and ready for playing.
Уникальная игра в свом роде, идеально подходящая для игры компанией. Советую ее всем любитель fps в духе хоррор!))

Killing Floor Uncut machen unter WIn 8.1 / WIn 7 

Den      "System"    Ordner von Killing Floor öffnen und die Datei "Default" mit dem standart Editor von windows öffnen. Bei Windows 7 ist der Datei Name  " Killing Floor.ini "

Dort sucht ihr dann die Zeile         [Engine.Engine]          und fügt das wie unteren Beispiel ein.         bdevgoreoverride=True    
      
BEISPIEL:



[Engine.Engine]
RenderDevice=D3D9Drv.D3D9RenderDevice
;RenderDevice=D3DDrv.D3DRenderDevice
;RenderDevice=Engine.NullRenderDevice
;RenderDevice=OpenGLDrv.OpenGLRenderDevice
;RenderDevice=PixoDrv.PixoRenderDevice
AudioDevice=ALAudio.ALAudioSubsystem
NetworkDevice=IpDrv.TcpNetDriver
DemoRecordingDevice=Engine.DemoRecDriver
Console=KFMod.KFConsole
GUIController=KFGUI.KFGUIController
StreamPlayer=Engine.StreamInteraction
Language=int
Product=KillingFloor
GameEngine=Engine.GameEngine
EditorEngine=Editor.EditorEngine
DefaultGame=KFMod.KFGameType
DefaultServerGame=KFMod.KFGameType
ViewportManager=WinDrv.WindowsClient
;ViewportManager=SDLDrv.SDLClient
Render=Render.Render
Input=Engine.Input
Canvas=Engine.Canvas
DetectedVideoMemory=0
ServerReadsStdin=False
bdevgoreoverride=True

[Core.System]
PurgeC.....bla
bla bla bla 


Viel Spaß !

It's almost as if it were an easier, more fair version version of L4D. However don't let that fool you. Some enemies maybe slow, but some can steam roll you if you camp or try to go solo. Find some friends and go play this glorified mess of a good time, and prepare your anal cavity from all of the sirens that will group up to rape your arse. One word of advice: Don't give your bloody dosh to greedy tosers. GIve it to those who actually look like they need it, mate.

If you like blowing off limbs or simply hacking a zombies head off, this is the game for you. Playing this with friends is not always a must, you can have just as much fun with a lobby full of strangers. I would strongly recommend buying this game, especially if it's on sale and you have yet to own it.


[b]Pros[/b]
[list]
    [*]Super fun in co-op
    [*]Not pay to win "all dlc is purely cosmetic, keeping the game challenging"
    [*]Huge variety of weapons
    [*]The ability to cut off limbs or blow zombies to pieces
    [*]Tons of maps
    [*]Amazing soundtrack "different music in almost every map"
    [*]Plenty of achievements "you will likely get at least 1-5 achievements per game"
    [*]6 different classes each with their own perks
    [*]Leveling system so you can improve your class of choice
[/list]


[b]Cons[/b]
[list]
    [*]The boss wave has the same boss every game and he has some really terrible voice acting
    [*]Game is a bit outdated since it is from 2009
    [*]Takes a long time to level up sadly
    [*]Minor bugs here and there
[/list]

If you don't plan on buying this game I strongly urge you to take a peek at Killing Floor 2 and consider picking it up cause it looks flawless

킬링플로어는 상당히 잘 만든 게임이라고 생각합니다. 굉장히 재밌죠. 그런데 쉽게 질립니다.저는 그 이유가 노잼자리가 존재하기 때문이라고 생각합니다. 어떤 게임이던지 항상 같은패턴은 쉽게 질리게 되어 있습니다.디펜스형식 게임의 취약점이죠. 맵의 구조상 
적이 나오는 좁은 한두개의 경로만 막는 형식은 금방 지루해지죠.  
그래서 이 게임이 상황마다 어쩔때는 굉장히 재밌을떄도 있지만 어쩔때는 루즈해질떄도 있습니다.킬링플로어 후속작품에는 맵의 구조를 살벌하게 만들고 여러가지 변수를 집어넣어서 항상 긴장을 놓칠수 없는 게임이 되기를 바랍니다. 
그럼에도 불구하고 잘 만들었고 재밌었기 때문에 추천드립니다.

Killing floor is a co-op survival horror game similar to 'COD Zombies' or 'No More Room in Hell'.  In this game you and a group of up to 5 friends survive against waves of Zeds (zombie like creatures).  The game has no story, it is strickly multiplayer but despite this I enjoy it. The twenty dollar price tag is a little high for this game.  I give this game an 8/10 for its fun co-op gameplay.
